instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3: What is PPBUS_G3? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. When you see PPBUS_G3, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.P5VS3_EN_L: What is P5VS3_EN_L? P5VS3_EN_L is a signal that enables the PP5V_S3 power rail when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B green light no fan spin
threads.message: Hello I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b with green light no fan spin <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3</SIGNAL> 12.55, from which I don't get <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B green light no fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B green light no fan spin
threads.message: The card initially had a short on pp3v42 due to <CHIP>U7941</CHIP>, solved <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS arepresent, on <TRANSISTOR>Q7221</TRANSISTOR> ho <SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B green light no fan spin
threads.message: Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> (at same time).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B green light no fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> B green light no fan spin
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> really drops from 3V to 0V?
If yes, try reballing SMC; may need to change it.
